attributes.action: Review the Agenda for change for band 4 Nursing Associates
attributes.additional_details:
Unlike other band 4s, eg. Assistant practitioner, therapy assistants, dental nurse, the NA are registered the same as nurse with the NMC, we deliver medication including I.V., we evaluate care plans providing patient centred care, making us accountable and responsible. We have to revalidate every 3 years same as nurse to remain competent and practice safely.
The NA role is very unsupported causing alot of negativity and confusion as to where we fit in within the NHS framework.
attributes.background:
Nursing Associates is a fairly new role in the NHS, the first cohort being 2018
Once qualified the main purpose of the NA was to bridge the gap between support worker and a registered nurse.
The role is basically known as a cheap nurse, with little difference between band 4 & 5.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

This is a matter for the NHS, not the UK Government or Parliament.
